title: Permaban for False Accusation of "3rd Party Program or Modifications"
body:
So I recently got banned for no reason after finally reaching the minimum for the end of season rewards for both Flex and Solo Q. I tried to log on the day after, but the log-in screen stated that I have been permanently banned and an email was sent. The email stated that I have been accused for "use of 3rd party programs or modifications". 
I submitted a ticket about it. However, the employee "Borrower" stated that the permaban will remain and later accuses me of scripting. 

Is there a way to prove that I did not script (because I obviously did not and have played all my games like a normal human being)? I suggested the employee to review the game clips, because it shows all the full-length games, but I'm pretty this person did not, since it wants to keep me banned...

replies.body:
Hey @OP --

Borrower and I took another look at your account and confirmed that the detection on the account is accurate. It was picked up for cheating in some URF games back in early March. 

Poking further, however, it looks like this took place on under some rogue access on the account from another state. We've forced reset the password on your account as a precaution, but you should be able to log in again once you complete it as the suspension has been lifted as a one-time exception. Apologies for missing this the first time.

Here's some additional tips on account security in case you need it: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664

There have been other false detections in the last round of bans. I would appreciate it if you and Borrower could please take a look at my account which was falsely banned for the same reason as OP. Please help me out here

This wasn't a false detection. Someone gained unauthorized access to their account and used applications that violated the Terms of Use. The detection systems are pretty accurate, and they're quick to identify any sources of false positives in the cases where there may be some.

I can only speak for my own case i suppose, but I most certainly have never used a 3rd party program or had my account compromised but was just randomly perma'd the other day.   A lot of others have also expressed confusion and complained leading me to think there was some error in the last batch of bans. Hopefully somebody takes a look into those who are affected and corrects this mess.

A lot of players seem to be experiencing the same issue, and you'll need to send in a support ticket and talk to the Riot staff:
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new

They do bans for using third party software in waves, and sometimes mistakes are made. Politely explain your situation and be patient, it will take up to a day for you to get your first reply. Continue to explain your situation and mention that there have been many players speaking up on the forum about being banned by mistake during this wave and ask for a manual review of your account. If Riot conducts the review and finds that you indeed did nothing wrong then your account will have the ban removed.

The key here is patience as you go through the motions.
Good luck!

I'm already 2 emails into a submitted ticket on what looks to be a revolving door of Me- "I got banned im innocent", riot- "We're sry, we are never wrong, we banned you, too bad."but I'm still holding out hope I guess, especially if more cases like this come to light although from what I've seen on the forums it seems pretty hopeless.

Their system seems to have falsely incriminated a number of innocent players (myself included), and they are failing to connect the dots. Hang in there and keep sending in tickets, eventually they will have to listen.
